pullRequest.body:
* This PR gets rid of the following pop-up, which is especially confusing for new users:
![image](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/assets/7376012/74df4731-00e6-4f63-ba33-818cf2040af0)
* Also remove the setting `search.usePCRE2` which is marked as "deprecated" and "enabled by default"

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: Do you know if we can instead make it so it recommends the lean4 plugin if not already installed. That would be even more useful IMO

That would be useful, yes, but I would have to look how to do that.
I guess that will also be disabled if we use this setting...
Ok I looked it up and pushed a file that recommends the lean 4 extension and explicitly bans the devcontainers one
Great! Did you test it? It looks good to me.
Nope I didn't sorry. I can try tomorrow but I didn't really want to uninstall the extension and restart my collection of vscode instances at the time

Testing requires a fresh install of VSCode, as these settings only affect the first time you open a workspace in VSCode.

Happily I had a VM sitting around with a fresh install of VSCode as a snapshot, so I tried it out and it worked beautifully.

bors merge

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: better VSCode extension recommendations

nodes.body: Do you know if we can instead make it so it recommends the lean4 plugin if not already installed. That would be even more useful IMO

That would be useful, yes, but I would have to look how to do that.
I guess that will also be disabled if we use this setting...
Ok I looked it up and pushed a file that recommends the lean 4 extension and explicitly bans the devcontainers one
Great! Did you test it? It looks good to me.
Nope I didn't sorry. I can try tomorrow but I didn't really want to uninstall the extension and restart my collection of vscode instances at the time

Testing requires a fresh install of VSCode, as these settings only affect the first time you open a workspace in VSCode.

Happily I had a VM sitting around with a fresh install of VSCode as a snapshot, so I tried it out and it worked beautifully.
